unittitle_ssm: Kill Van Kull Bridge construction photographs
abstract_ssm: One photograph album depicting the 1929-1931 construction of the Bayonne Bridge, then referred to as the Kill Van Kull Bridge. The album holds 23 silver gelatin photographs. Most of the photos show the erection of the bridge's arches at various stages in 1930 and the bridge's piers; some are aerial views, most at eye level. A few photos from 1929 show the bottom of the cofferdam and later 1931 photos show the nearly completed bridge from various angles. Only a couple photos include the laborers; one depicts the workers positioning a steel panel during arch erection.
corpname_ssm: Port Authority of New York and New Jersey
